intro: Androsace fragilis, commonly known as the fragrant rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. Androsace fragilis thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous areas with high altitudes.
